intro: Klainedoxa mildbraedii, commonly known as the mountain onion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous underground stems. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers during the spring and summer seasons. Its leaves are typically grass-like and grow in dense tufts, while its flowers are often arranged in a raceme. Klainedoxa mildbraedii is adapted to grow in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions.
